Subjective: Sore throat for 3 days. Fever since this morning. Preceded by cough last week, now resolved. Severe pain on swallowing ('unbearable'). Meds: Paracetamol and ibuprofen taken, no relief. No shortness of breath, no runny nose. Able to drink, but very painful. Social: Friend recently had a throat abscess. ICE (Concern/Request): Worried about an abscess; thinks she needs antibiotics.
Objective: Temp: 38.3 C. Sat: 98%. Ears: Left - air-filled eardrum, no inflammation. Right - slight redness in ear canal, otherwise normal. Neck: Small, non-pathological submandibular lymph nodes. Throat: Uvula median, slightly red pharyngeal arch, slightly enlarged tonsils with slough on both sides. No kissing tonsils. No signs of abscess. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds.
Assessment: Viral throat infection. Ruled out: Peritonsillar abscess.
Plan: 1. Explanation of viral nature; antibiotics not indicated. 2. Paracetamol up to 4 times/day. 3. Ibuprofen 400mg up to 3 times/day. 4. Advice: Cold drinks or popsicles for pain relief; maintain hydration. 5. Safety net: Contact if condition worsens, develops shortness of breath, or unable to swallow.
